course_title: Foundations of Modern Biology I Lab
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 17Waitlist Total: 0
requirement_designation: Science, Nature and Technology with Lab
class_notes: In lab, you will learn to: (1) design and carry out independent research projects, (2) organize and analyze simple experimental datasets, and (3) communicate findings with concise graphs, text, or presentation.
course_description: Introduces students to scientific inquiry in the laboratory. Students design, implement, analyze and present authentic research projects. Along with Biology 141, 142 and 142L, meets the requirement for medical and dental school and the biology major.
prerequisites: BIOL 141 or BIOL_OX 141 as co-requisite or CHEM 141 or CHEM_OX 141 as prerequisite or equivalent transfer credit as co-requisite or prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 1571, Section #: 1, Type: LAB, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 2-5p, Instructor: M. Cole, Status: Open
